conflict_resolutions.overlapping_high_priority: High-priority termination cases GR-048 (deadline 11/11) and GR-044 (deadline 11/14) could not be scheduled by their guideline latest hearing dates (11/8 and 11/9 respectively) due to participant unavailability conflicts. Resolution involved scheduling them early in Week 2 (GR-044 on Mon 11/13 09:00-11:00, GR-048 on Tue 11/14 09:00-11:00) in Conference Room A. This prioritized these critical cases while accommodating key participants like J. Smith (needed for both) and witnesses, although it required scheduling closer to the deadline than the 3-day guideline suggested.
conflict_resolutions.conference_room_limitation: Conference Room A, required for termination cases GR-044 and GR-048 due to privacy needs and participant count (5 each), had several pre-existing bookings. Scheduling was managed by utilizing available morning slots in Week 2 (Mon 11/13 09:00-11:00 for GR-044, Tue 11/14 09:00-11:00 for GR-048). Case GR-042 (5 participants) was scheduled into an available afternoon slot in Conf A (Wed 11/8 13:00-14:30). Other cases with fewer participants or not requiring privacy were assigned to Conference Room B or Meeting Room C based on availability and capacity (e.g., GR-046 in C, GR-043 in B).
conflict_resolutions.key_witness_accommodation: Witness C. Lee, required for high-priority termination case GR-044, had limited availability (unavailable Fri 11/10, Wed 11/15, Tue 11/21). Initial attempts to schedule GR-044 within Week 1 failed partly due to C. Lee's unavailability on 11/10. The case was successfully scheduled for Monday, November 13th from 09:00 to 11:00 in Conference Room A, a date and time when C. Lee and all other required participants were available, thereby accommodating this key witness's constraints.

special_accommodations.accommodation: Requires a room with privacy features due to termination status. Assigned Conference Room A.
Requires a room with privacy features due to termination status. Assigned Conference Room A.
